title: Egypt Court Orders Release of Rights Activist Patrick George Zaki After Trial Postponed
sub_head: An Egyptian graduate who was studying in Italy, Zaki was arrested in February 2020 and accused of spreading false news about Egypt
body:
An Egyptian court ordered the provisional release of an activist imprisoned for nearly two years in a case that has intensified international scrutiny of the country’s human-rights record.
Patrick George Zaki, an Egyptian graduate studying in Italy, was arrested in February last year during a visit home. He was accused of spreading false news about the country after he wrote an article about discrimination against Egypt’s Christian minority, according to a statement from the Egyptian Initiative for Personal Rights, a rights group for which Mr. Zaki is a researcher.
